Welcome to Border Cases.

After years of bad generalization, I guess I've finally decided to kick the habit. I am distinterested or at least should be disinterested in the average. Boundary cases cover all our expectations, asserting that we are not caught off guard. Fringes are dual, threatening to surprise us and challaenge our preconceptions. At some point I woke up in the morning, thinking to myself how being an outlier - beating the averages - has become the only safe game in town.

Border cases, all of them. I write this blog because I want to know, act like, and be one of the outliers; this is my journal for my efforts.
